intro: Pimpinella peucedanifolia, commonly known as the European cow parsley, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbrella-like clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. It is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, and it has a long history of use in traditional medicine. The seeds are often used in herbal remedies for their potential digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
